name: deimosrising
text: Ethan Frome is not worth the shit I wiped off my ass with it.

name: hellaedgar
text: Agreed.

name: alejandroadam
text: never read a book that was written only in an effort to practice frence. NEVER

name: alejandroadam
text: *French*

name: hamscout
text:
[french accent]
Ah, a depressing story of broken people, trapped in unsatisfying lives...how real ...
As Dickens said: "We forge the chains we wear in life."
[/french accent]

name: 1000hz
text: Man, no joke. Damn you, 10th Grade, for introducing me to That Book.

name: equinn2006
text: Tell it to the pipes, pal.

name: kledermans
text: That must be why the book stinks, in a literal sense.  Because I can't imagine Lyle holding a book like that except perhaps to investigate the source of a stench.

name: killerlimpet
text: Good christ you're right

name: blueloggy
text:
EVERY TIME I hear/read the title Ethan Frome I sing the following song in my head, to the tune of Pearl Jam's Evenflow:
Ethan Fro-ome,
Can't drive a sled to save his life!

It's like I'm being tortured by the corniest pun-loving-est corner of my own brain. I've never ever read the damn book (obviously?)

name: ted0phile
text:
Holy shit.

Holy shit.

(Everyone chubby the above comment)

name: gournal
text:
Singing that in my head made me laugh as hard as "tell it to the pipes, pal."

I'm amazed.

name: belgand
text:
Seriously, that is just a terrible book.

Of all the books I was required to read in school most were good, some I disliked, but could appreciate the cultural value of, a number I really loved, but Ethan Frome was just awful. I've never even heard anyone say anything even remotely good about it. Why in the hell does that shit continue to show up in the curriculum at so many schools? Same thing with A Separate Peace

name: dusty
text: Yes, A Separate Peace , you read it waiting for some stuff to start happening, and before a real character can even show up, someone dies and the book ends.

name: scifigrl47
text:
No New Englander tries to kill himself by sledding into a tree. This is because we have all run face first into trees and lived.

I sat in a tenth grade classroom of Yankees thinking, "Seriously? Sledding accident. You're a moron. My kid brother put a ski mask on backwards and ran face first into an oak, broke two ribs and split his head wide open and he's still taking college prep courses. This is bull."

name: dusty
text: ...still taking college prep courses (despite the fact that he graduated college 3 years ago, before the sledding accident). This is bull.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray has a pretty swinging cat playground there.

text: I have long wondered how that strip would have played out.

text: he would bring up the hibachi and call the fellows, but for different reasons

text: Five funny panels

text: The one where he says, "Is it still there?"  Because that is my fave Red Meat ever too.

name: notcool
text: I have that T-shirt from the first time it went on sale. It is ragged, torn at the bottom, and still in circulation.

name: petro
text: Ethan Frome is a texts for profs who either hate themselves, or as is more common, who hate their students. Oh, where's a sledding accident when you need one?

name: terrainasaur
text: this is like gbv's "back to saturn x radio report". i wanna see strips of those so bad.

text: Lyle looks so appalled and disgusted, it's actually pretty funny.

text: His expressions in the third and last panels are exactly alike. So which one were you talking about?

text: Ethan Frome DOES stink.
